intro: Lechlera sisyrinchium, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Lechlera sisyrinchium is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient and adaptive species.
